metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0875 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
SystemTap 1.7, 1.6.7, and probably other versions, when unprivileged mode is enabled, allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (kernel panic and crash) via vectors related to crafted DWARF data, which triggers a read of an invalid pointer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0875` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

systemtap - 2.2.1-1
systemtap-client - 2.2.1-1
systemtap-common - 2.2.1-1
systemtap-runtime - 2.2.1-1
systemtap-server - 2.2.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemtap package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-1').
